intro: Bryaspis lupulina, commonly known as the yellow moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. Its leaves are closely arranged and often have a distinctive, flattened structure. Bryaspis lupulina plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various small organisms.
